TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
AMENDMENT TO THE MOTION FOR REUNIFICATION COUNSELOR
Comes now the Plaintiff/Respondent/Father, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and
through his attorney, Dianne James Davis, and files this Amendment to the Motion for
Reunification Counselor for reunification therapy and would state as follows:
1. That Counsel for the Father sent a letter to Kelly Turner on February 14, 2025, to put
her on notice that Counsel would be deposing her – Copy Attached as Exhibit A;
2. That Kelly Turner responded to the letter via email on February 14, 2025, at 11:46 pm
and stating: “I did withdrawal myself from the case via that email . I have not
agreed to continue RT at this time . Therefore, I am unsure what you are referring
to . However , if there is a court order that specifically indicates me to continue with
RT, at this time , I respectfully would decline .” Email attached as Exhibit “B”;
3. That obviously there was some misunderstanding between the Defendant and or her
attorney regarding her continued service.
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, the Father respectfully requests this Court appoint
Caroline Taylor, a specialist in reunification for the mother and child.
Respectfully submitted this the 26th day of February, 2025.
DOCUMENT 159
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)

RE: Brittany Michelle Gilliland vs, Christopher Blaine McGregor
Case #70-DR-2023-90005 1.01
Minor Child: Addie Kate McGregor
Dear Mrs. Turner:
I am now representing Mr. McGregor in the domestic relations case styled above.
I need from ybu, dates you are available next month for a deposition.
If you would be so kind to inform me the reasoning behind the email you sent to
Mr. McGregor on January 14,2025, stating 66Based off Blaine,s most receni email
(which Brittany was not inctuded) unfortunately,I am removing myself from this
case. I wish you both the best in your journey to healing. However, I am not going
to be able to continue to assist moving forward."
Then in your Affidavit you provided to Ms. Gilliland's counsel who in turn
EFiled it with the Court you stated "As a professional, with 25 years of experience and
over 100 cases working with custody/divorce/alienation, this situation fett higtrly
manipulative and as a professionalr l realized that this process was not goinfto ne
conducive, nor effective, and a decision was made to withdrawarrr.
In Court on February 13,2025, Mrs. Gilliland and her attorney Barbara Agricola
informed the Court that you were back on board and you would be willing to continue the
"reunification therapy". If this is in fact the case, I find it highly unusual ihat you would
withdraw on l-13-2025 and then present an affidavit to the court on February 13,2025,
that you would not longer provide services.
frnd it highly unusual that you would make such harsh statements as in your
Affidvit and then in less than twenty -four (24) hours, you were ready to start theiapy
again.

depositions. I will make the necessary arrangerlrents once the dates are received.
